name: St Giles Apartments

reviews.text: We stayed 2 nights in the old fishmarket apartment. It was clean and modern, in a good location just off the royal mile. A good choice for a family as reasonably priced, 2 separate bedrooms. Only small issue was a noisy hotwater/heating system which we turned off at night due to the noise. otherwise a good stay.
reviews.title: good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just home after a 4 day stay in st giles apartment 3 on easter weekend.3 bed apartment with kitchen and seperate living room.have stayed in edinburgh before but were delighted with this apartment.great location, bang in the middle of the royal mile, just a stones throw away from plenty of restaurants, pubs and clubs. as well as that the apartment was very modern and well equiped.staff could not of been more welcoming or helpful.hopefully will return to edinburgh soon and will definately be staying here again.
reviews.title: fantastic stay

reviews.text: The apartment we had (Old Fishmarket Alley) was comfortable, roomy, and the location can't be beat. The bathroom fixtures were a bit old and the sink would probably have come off the wall if you leaned on it (wobbled when I touched it) but by the standards of UK accomodations in this price range, very good.
reviews.title: Comfy, roomy, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As in any city center, there are going to be drunken louts out in the streets and alleys at night. That was no different here. Earplugs recommended.
reviews.title: Not what we expected!

reviews.text: We have been using trip adviser daily to find accomadation in the UK whilst on a 3 Week road trip . I am hooked,it is the best tool to us when traveling and until today our accomadation has been either what we expected or excelled our expectations. Not so with the St Giles appartments,they lack anylove what so ever and in fact feel quiet cold. I think these particular appartments are very over priced compared to other accomadations.last night when we paid £39 for a double bed & breakfast and were more than happy,tonight we splurged and paid £89 with no breakfast and are disappointed. The bed is very uncomfortable with a very cheap mattress , no TV in the bedroom,no face washers,tissues. The washing machine / dryer is one of those all in one's that we can't work out how to use. I dont like being negative so the positives are that Its in a handy position ,the water & juice in the fridge are a nice touch as are the white fluffy towels. But that's it!!
reviews.title: Old Fishmarket Apartments; centrally located but very disappointing and sadly not recommended.

reviews.text: The St Giles apartment is directly across High St from St Giles Cathederal. I was worried that the location would be noisy and the apartment less than advertized. I was wrong. The apartment was absolutely perfect for a family with children. My daughter and her husband and baby had one bedroom while my wife and I had the other. The living room was extra large and the kitchen fully equiped with a washer and dryer, which the baby put to good use!
reviews.title: Great for families

reviews.text: The location was fantastic and close to every Edinburgh attraction. The only slight problem was long term parkign which was about 2 blocks away at the Radisson lot on Blackfriars St. Once I figured out the drill it was fine.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We stayed in Advocate's Close, St. Giles apartments, Edinburgh 2nd to 6th June 2012. We had a two bedroom, dining/drawing room with kitchen duplex apartment. Our experience was highly satisfactory. Excellent location right on Royal Mile, the action packed place in Edinburgh. This building has a historic importance as it is dated 1890. Market, eateries, tour pick up points, Castle all walking distance. Modern, fully equiped and neat clean. Our check in and out were smooth. Quiet inside the apartment and quite close to their office. Nothing to complain and all thank you from me and family. We enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Apartment #2 was perfect

reviews.text: We stayed in #2 and it was perfect for group of 4. Place felt new, spacious, clean and also very well equipped. Full kitchen, washer-dryer and free Internet. Location can't be better - right across from St Giles Cathedral in the middle of the royal mile. Windows of this apartment faced away from the street so not noisy at all.
reviews.title: Great location!
Luck of the draw
reviews.text: Was also great value - we paid just 89 pounds for a 1 night stay in this 2 bedroom apartment.

I booked this apartment through Bookings.com so we did not know which of the 3 six guest flats we would get. The check in was easy and the location of this apartment is superb. The apartment is done to a very high spec with 3 double bedrooms and 2 baths which also includes a very large fully equipped kitchen and large dining/living area. It really is the perfect place with one MAJOR exception! It's very very loud in the lounge and front 2 bedrooms. Although the road below is closed to most traffic, given the stone street, when a car drives by you hear it. When the deliveries to surrounding shops and flats begins at 6am you hear that too. When the bells of the St Giles cathedral start at 6am you hear them, and when the groups of students return from the pubs at 1am you get to hear that too. This makes for very short nights. This could all be solved by improving the quality of the windows. I really hope that the owners will improve the windows as I would like to stay here again.
reviews.title: Rude Awakenings!
Perfect location
reviews.text: Was a perfect location, clean, great view - loved it! Location was perfect and laundry in apartment a plus. It was easy to check in, even as we arrived late in the evening - great instructions! I would recommend this apartment highly. Loads of resturants and within walking to major attractions.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: St Giles Apartment has one of the better location for a tourist visiting Edinburgh. Located right opposite the St Giles Church and on the Royal Mile, it was really nice to walk in and out of the Apartment to nearby tourists spot.
reviews.title: Location Location Location

reviews.text: The apartment we had, included a microwave and a washing machine.
reviews.title: Pefect location, great apartments

reviews.text: We hope the Management will continue to maintain the quality of the place, and if it remains the same (if note better), we will definitely return to St Giles.
reviews.title: Ok but better for larger groups

reviews.text: I have just stayed at one of the St Giles Apartments. A lovely apartment with 3 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms. Very tasteful decor. Our group was 2 adults and 4 teenagers. We were very comfortable there. The best feature was probably the location.
reviews.title: Luxury in a great location.

reviews.text: We stayed a night at the Fishmarket Close for the second consecutive year. Excellent location close to Royal mile, the Castle and almost nextdoor to Brewdog Pub. Very friendly and helpful staff at the office.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.text: The best thing about this apartment was the location. We were right in the middle of the Royal Mile, exactly opposite St Giles' Cathedral and a 5 minute walk away from the castle. We stayed for a couple of nights and all in all we were really pleased with the apartment. It was clean and well equipped with everything that you would need including appliances, iron, cleaning products, towels and tableware. They had even left is complimentary orange juice and bottled water. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were lovely with good showers. We were in apartment 6 on the top floor so the stairs were a bit of a struggle, especially for older people in the group-if you have anyone who isn't very mobile, it's probably not the best place to stay, so check that you are on a lower floor. The bedrooms were lovely however the one we stayed in was quite small and got very hot at night - the other 2 bedrooms were bigger. It is noisy outside at night but I wouldn't expect anything else from a city centre location on a Saturday night. The price wasn't too bad but maybe a little on the expensive side. Overall, St Giles' apartments are in an amazing location, clean and well equipped and the staff are friendly and accomodating. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Perfect location and lovely apartment.

reviews.text: Stayed on top floor overlooking St. Giles Cathedral. Apartment was very large for our family of five, including three teenagers. Two clean and modern bathrooms with showers. Modern decor. Hardwood floors. Large, comfortable beds. No elevators, so a tough walk to fifth floor with heavy luggage. Easy access to all Edinburgh sites on foot.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.text: Amazing view, lovely apartment (Apartment 5) and comfy beds. Great living room and fantastic shower. Dining table was wobbly, the windows were quite dirty and there was also quite a lot of noise from outside on the Saturday night even in late January, but this is to be expected considering the incredible location. However, any negatives were seriously outweighed by positives and I would recommend to anyone.
reviews.title: Incredible Weekend Break

description: St. Giles Apartments offers self catering accommodation in the heart of Edinburgh at great value for money. Our self catering apartments are furnished to excellent standards, designer finished, fully equipped with all crockery and linens. Situated conveniently for all of Edinburgh’s attractions our apartments make for an exceptional base while visiting our historic city.By staying with us you will find great value when comparing to a city centre hotel but with the added benefit of your own living room, dining area, fully equipped kitchen and most importantly privacy.
